back_flavor: In a fit of frustration, confusion, and sorrow, Anna Anderson attempted suicide by jumping from a bridge in Berlin. Failing, she was committed to an asylum. When questioned of her identity, the woman claimed to be the missing Princess Anastasia Nikolaevna. After wandering in a deep state of shock for years, Anna said she woke to a phantom song lilting over her nightmares. It was the tainted voice of Grigori Rasputin. In it, she could sense the evil that had taken her brother Alexei from her. “Such drivel!” laughed the nurses in the ward, but with no evidence to the contrary nor any criminal charges to hold her, Anna was released to the world with nothing more than her determination to prove her identity and a book of ravings she believes to be Rasputin's mad poetry. Hungering to stop what had been set in motion, Anna's conviction drives her to pursue every means available to destroy the Mad Monk's demons. But will anyone believe her? Some days, Anna isn't even sure she believes it herself.
back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-5, Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-2, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Phantom Melody, The Voynich Manuscript, 1 random basic weakness
flavor: "You either believe it or you don't believe it. It doesn't matter. In no way whatsoever."
name: Anna Anderson
text:
You may commit [willpower] icons to any type of test. They act as [wild] icons for the duration of the skill test.
[elder_sign] effect: +0. If successful, you may search your deck for Phantom Melody and play it immediately for no cost. If you do, shuffle your deck.

flavor: "This language is unique. Why can I read this?"
name: The Voynich Manuscript
text:
Anna Anderson deck only.
You get +1 [willpower]. If your remaining sanity is 4 or less, you get +1 additional [willpower].
[fast] Exhaust The Voynich Manuscript: If you have no cards in your hand, draw 2 cards.
[reaction] When you deal damage, if a card was committed with a [willpower] icon, you deal +1 damage.

flavor: "It is natural to indulge in the illusions of hope. We are apt to shut our eyes to that siren until she allures us to our death."  -Gertrude Stein
name: Phantom Melody
text: Disengage each non-elite enemy, and move each other investigator and each non-elite enemy to your location. Forced - When you or another investigator plays a [[Spell]] card or activates a [[Spell]] effect on another card while Phantom Melody is in your hand: Reveal Phantom Melody and cancel that play or activation effect paying its costs.

back_flavor: Anton Pavel grew up Romani. Every day, he experienced the prejudice and curious stares of the strangers around him, but it didn't matter. For if you are Romani, you have family everywhere. Honing his acrobatic skills as a boy, Anton spent his adulthood traveling with a circus and meeting his long lost brothers all over the world. It was in these camps that he deepened his understanding of his Romani roots. For it is told that they are the blessed people, standing like a beacon in the darkness with reserves of powerful relics shared between them. The knowledge required to hold back the tide is passed from camp to camp, story by story. A name for every monster, every wickedness, and sometimes, too, their weaknesses. There is danger in the written word, for it can be lost or destroyed. Stories last longer. And they can spread like wildfire, fanned by necessity.
back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: [[Relic]] cards 0-5, level 0-3 Assets/Events/Skills with each type limited to a single and different class ([seeker]/[mystic]/[survivor]/[rogue]/[guardian]), Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Campfire Tales, The Scales of Thoth, 1 random basic weakness.
flavor: "They say my people descended from the Egyptians. After our exile, is it so surprising we began to traffic in gilded relics and ancient secrets?"
name: Anton Pavel
text:
While you have more damage than horror, you get +1 [combat] and +1 [agility]. While you have more horror than damage, you get +1 [willpower] and +1 [intellect].
[elder_sign] effect: +3. If successful, you may treat this skill test as if it were a tie.

name: The Scales of Thoth
text:
Anton Pavel deck only.
[reaction] After a skill test results in a tie, draw a card.
[fast] Take one direct damage: Heal one horror. (limit once per turn).
[fast] Take one direct horror: Heal one damage. (limit once per turn).

flavor: "Story has it, the creature has one weakness..."
name: Campfire Tales
text: Revelation – Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a non-elite enemy is discarded. Attach Campfire Tales to that enemy and spawn it. Forced - Attached enemy may only be damaged or defeated by investigators with a [[Relic]] in play. When the game ends, if attached enemy is in play: You suffer 1 trauma of the type you have fewest of.

back_flavor: Even at a young age, Astrid was a gossip. At twenty-three, the stories didn't stop. So what if Hattie's father wasn't actually in prison. So what if nobody was ever actually murdered in the abandoned house next door? It was all in fun... until they found Harold's corpse. And Hattie stopped coming to work. It was then that Astrid thought of all the lies she had told the girls—all the horrible, unspeakable things that would occur. It was too late to take them back, but she knew she had to put an end to the tales she had woven. Prayer failing, Astrid braced herself to discover and end the source of the unnatural influence she seemed to have been cursed with.
back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: [[Insight]] cards level 0-5, Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5, [[Fortune]] cards level 0, up to five other level 0 Mystic and/or Survivor cards ([mystic] and/or [survivor]). Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Two Can Keep A Secret, Rumor Has It, 1 random basic weakness. Deckbuilding Restrictions: no [[Blessed]] cards.

deck_options.error: You cannot have more than 5 Mystic and/or Survivor cards

flavor: "Everybody knows Addie's mother has a drinking problem. Just ask around..."
name: Astrid Lee
text:
[action] Seal [elder_sign]: your location has -1 shroud while [elder_sign] is sealed. When there are no clues on your location, return [elder_sign] to the chaos bag.
[elder_sign] effect: +2. If successful, discard the top three cards of the encounter deck and gain a resource for each treachery discarded.

name: Rumor Has It
subname: News in a Red Satin Dress
text: Astrid Lee deck only. Fast. Forced -- After Rumor Has It enters play: Place 1 doom on it. Doom cannot be removed from Rumor Has It except by abilities on this card. When the game ends, if Rumor Has It has no doom on it, add it to the victory display. Connecting locations have -1 shroud for each doom token on this card. [reaction] When you draw a non-weakness treachery card, place 1 doom on Rumor Has It, then cancel its revelation effect. (Limit once per round.) [fast] Draw an Encounter card, then remove 1 doom token from this card.

name: Two Can Keep A Secret
text: Revelation - Discard all ally assets you control. If no assets are discarded as a result of this effect, take 1 direct horror and shuffle Two Can Keep A Secret back into your deck.

back_flavor: Edmund lost his parents at a young age. It was only a matter of time before he fell in with the local toughs, the Sheldon Gang. Most nights, Edmund was used for his diminutive stature and agile fingers to panhandle or work the crowd. But then, a woman in a peacock blue coat passed him a look of disgust instead of a dime. Edmund followed her, but turning a corner she impossibly vanished. Something wasn't right. He dreamt of the woman and her obscene blue coat. She stood glaring at him from the side of his cot. The following day, Edmund waylaid the Miss, knocking her to the ground, but the woman ripped out of his grip with an unholy strength, leaving her coat behind. Inside he found the Key. Holding it, Edmund found that he became more slippery than an eel and had access to every corner and sealed-off nook of Arkham. So why was he suddenly so afraid?
back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-5, Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-2, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Mother?, The Silver Key, 1 random basic weakness.
flavor: Once in a while, though, he could not help seeing how shallow, fickle, and meaningless all human aspirations are, and how emptily our real impulses contrast with those pompous ideals we profess to hold.  ― H.P. Lovecraft, The Silver Key
name: Edmund Moore
text:
[fast] Spend two resources: Exhaust one non-elite enemy at your location. (Limit once per round)
[elder_sign] effect: +0. If you succeed, exhaust all enemies at your location.

name: The Silver Key
text: Edmund Moore deck only. Uses (3 charges). [reaction] When a non-elite enemy spawns at your location, spend 1 charge: Exhaust that enemy. [action] Spend 1 charge: Evade. You get +2 for this evade. If you succeed by 2 or more, discover 1 clue at your location.

flavor: "And the anger, meanness, and disappointment which began inside of her simply radiated out toward me.” ― Peg Streep, Mean Mothers: Overcoming the Legacy of Hurt
name: Mother?
text: Aloof. Revelation - Discard 1 accessory asset under your control. Forced - After Mother? enters play: Place 1 doom on it.

back_flavor: Eunice knew that her love for her fiancé was true the day they had their first argument over non-Euclidean geometry. She worked for days attempting to compose a mathematical question he could not answer. Finally, she had done it. The angles were impossible, but they were undeniable. When she confronted him, he took one look and said she was mad. Eunice found him the next day hanging from the balcony, leaflets of paper strewn over the ground below. And the equation! It had changed, but the proof retained veracity. Through her grief Eunice could see she had discovered a horrible truth. Reality was in flux; it was coming undone!
back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, [[Paradox]] cards level 0-5, up to five level 0 cards from any other class. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Arithmophobia, Yig's Constant, 1 random basic weakness

deck_options.error: You cannot have more than 5 cards that are not Seeker, Neutral, or Paradox traited.

flavor: "A quadratic with a positive and negative solution; a confidence interval in which I had no confidence..."
name: Eunice Golding
text:
[reaction] After you investigate: look at the top 1 [per_investigator] cards of the encounter deck, and return them to the top in any order. (Limit once per turn.)
[elder_sign] effect: +2. If Yig's Constant is in play, return an event card in your discard to your hand.

name: Yig's Constant
text:
Eunice Goulding deck only.
[fast] Place 1 Doom on Yig's Constant: Discard the top Encounter. (Limit once per turn).
[action] Exhaust Yig's Constant: Gain 1 resource or draw 1 card for each doom in play. If more than 3 doom are in play, discard Yig's Constant and cancel the next encounter card you draw during the mythos phase. (Limit once per round.)

name: Arithmophobia
text: Revelation - Add Arithmophobia to your threat area. Treat Eunice's printed text box as if it were blank (except for [[Traits]]). You have -3 [intellect]. Forced - If you fail a [intellect] test, take 1 horror. If you pass a [intellect] test, discard Arithmophobia.

back_flavor: Hosea is practically a fixture in Arkham. He has been working the mines of Black Cave for nearly two decades. Folk in town think of Hosea as “Good People”—the kind who will always have your back in a jam. When rumors began of the mines sheltering bandits, ruffians, and other things, the miners went on strike. Most took other work in Innsmouth or as far out as Dunwich country. Not Hosea. Then, the trusty local returned from the mines with a missing girl from Miskatonic U. A blubbering mess, all she could could utter was “It's... it's unnamable!” Hosea finally had evidence that the dangers weren't just to Black Cave and Arkham, but all the places its dark winding tunnels might lead. And there were other caves. And other towns. Hosea was going to need help.
back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: [[Ally]] cards level 0-5, Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5, [[Innate]] cards level 0, up to five other level 0 Seeker and/or Survivor cards ([seeker] and/or [survivor]). Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): With Friends Like These, Hosea's Pickaxe, 1 random basic weakness.

deck_options.error: You cannot have more than 5 Seeker and/or Survivor cards

flavor: "Listen! Black Cave is just the beginning, friend!"
name: Hosea Mayhew
text:
You have 1 additional Ally slot.
[reaction] When another investigator at your location takes 1 or more damage, you may take 1 of that damage instead (limit once per source).
[elder_sign] effect: +0. If successful, you may search your deck for an ally and play it, reducing its resource cost by 1 for each point you succeed by.

name: Hosea's Pickaxe
text: Hosea Mayhew deck only. [action] Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. If an [[Ally]] you control or another investigator at your location is damaged, this attack deals +1 damage. [reaction] When you perform a resource action, gain 1 additional resource. (limit once per turn.)

flavor: “You are going to break your promise. I understand. And I hold my hands over the ears of my heart, so that I will not hate you.” ― Catherynne M. Valente, Deathless
name: With Friends Like These
text: Prey - Hosea Mayhew Only. Hunter. [revelation] Attach a non-story [[Ally]] asset you control to this card. If you cannot, shuffle it back into your deck. X is equal to the resource cost of the attached card +1. This card has [combat] and [agility] equal to half of the attached card's resource cost rounded up.

back_flavor: The “Obi-man” knew the alliances of the Loa were shifting. During an invocation, Papa Legba warned of a great awakening of an angry elder power, a Loa so poisonous and toxic to the world that it had been sealed away in a deep slumber. And now a schism slowly erodes at the ancient loyalties among the nanchon. The Ghede were not happy, and the Petro were considering waking the Old One themselves. Legba needed help. The “Obi-man” would need some powerful gris-gris to keep the energies in balance. He could feel them trembling.
back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: [[Charm]] and [[Relic]] cards 0-5, Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 5 other level 0 cards from any other class. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Papa Legba's Price, Strong Gris-gris, 1 random basic weakness.

deck_options.error: You cannot have more than 5 cards that are not Mystic or Neutral

flavor: "One must begin with an object worthy of the Loa."
name: Obi Laveau
text:
[fast] Remove a [[Charm]] or [[Relic]] card in your play area from the game and take 1 direct damage (choose one):
- Remove 1 doom from your location.
- Remove 1 doom from a card attached to your location.
- Remove 1 doom from a card you control.
[elder_sign] effect: +1 for each [[Charm]] or [[Relic]] in your play area.

name: Strong Gris-gris
text:
Obi Leveau deck only.
[reaction] When you reveal a [skull], exhaust Strong Gris-gris and gain a resource.
[reaction] When you reveal a [cultist], exhaust  Strong Gris-gris and heal 1 horror.
[reaction] When you reveal a [tablet], exhaust Strong Gris-gris and heal 1 damage.
[reaction] When you reveal a [elder_thing], exhaust Strong Gris-gris and ready a card in your play area.

name: Papa Legba's Price
text: Revelation - Exhaust all assets you control and put Papa Legba's Price into play in your threat area. Treat all assets you control as if they have no traits and they cannot ready. [action] Take 1 damage and spend 1 resource, then discard Papa Legba's Price.

back_flavor: "Some of the men downtown, they aren't just Johns; they're monsters!" At first, Sadie thought the girls were just exaggerating. That was until one of her clients got rougher than usual, biting and clawing at her flesh, drawing blood. He wouldn't stop. So Sadie made him. Then she noticed the irregular shape of his hands and the darkness pooling in his empty eyes. Afterwards, she changed. At night, Sadie began losing chunks of time, often waking covered in viscera. Whatever it had made her, it had paid for it. Abomination that she was, so would the rest.
back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-5, Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-2, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Upright Beast, Sadie's Lucky Cigarette Case, 1 random basic weakness.
flavor: "The nearer a man gets to being a beast, the less he knows it." ― George MacDonald
name: Sadie Godfrey
text:
[fast] Take 1 direct horror: You get +2 [combat] for this test.
[elder_sign] effect: +X. X is the number of cards in your threat area. If this test succeeds, you may deal 1 damage to each enemy and each other investigator at your location.

name: Sadie's Lucky Cigarette Case
text:
Sadie Godfrey deck only.
Uses (3 Cigarettes)
[fast] Spend 1 Cigarette: Heal 1 horror for each card in your threat area.
[fast] Spend 1 Cigarette: Engage all enemies at your location.
[fast] Spend 2 Cigarettes: cancel a non-weakness [[Terror]] card you have just drawn.

name: Upright Beast
text: Revelation - Put Upright Beast into play in your threat area. Discard all allies you control. Forced - When another investigator enters a location Sadie is in or vice versa, that investigator takes 1 horror. [action] Exhaust Upright Beast and test [willpower] (3). If successful, discard Upright Beast.
